comments:
When debugging a java application, the user can invoke a "Run to Line" action by using the "CTRL+R" shortcut.

This short has stopped working after having BIRT installed.  CTRL+R seems to be used in BIRT as well to "Create Cross Tab".  If I invoke the action, I get a "Create Cross Tab" hint at the bottom right corner.  

I am wondering should really be enabled when my focus is in a Java editor.  Will user try to "Create Cross Tab" when working in a Java File?

When invoking CTRL+R, C, I got the following exception in the log:

Correction:
I am wondering if the shortcut should really be enabled when my focus is in a Java editor. Will user try to "Create Cross Tab" when working in a Java File?
Reassign to UI team for further investigation.
Please remove this in plugin.xml, we don't need this specific shortcut key.
